title: System Rule Schema
description: Defines the structure for a System Rule file, which represents a piece of data-driven game logic based on the Event-Condition-Action (ECA) pattern. A rule listens for a specific event, optionally checks conditions, and executes a sequence of actions.

$schema.description: Optional. URI reference to the schema this rule definition file conforms to (for editor tooling).

rule_id.description: Optional unique identifier for the rule, useful for debugging and logging.
rule_id.$comment: While optional in schema, strongly recommended for traceability.

event_type.description: Required. Specifies the namespaced ID of the event that triggers this rule's evaluation.

condition.description: Optional. Specifies the condition (using JSON Logic format) that must evaluate to true for the `actions` to execute. If omitted, the actions are always executed upon event trigger.
condition.$comment: References the standard JSON Logic structure.

actions.description: Required. Ordered list of Operation objects to execute sequentially if the rule's event_type matches and its condition (if any) evaluates to true. Operations define interactions like querying/modifying components or dispatching new events.

items.description: A single Operation or macro reference as defined in operation.schema.json.

comment.description: Optional. A human-readable description or note for developers or modders; ignored by the interpreter at runtime.
